alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Summers (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 27 at 4:01PM EDT until July 28 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Tazewell County in southwestern Virginia... Mercer County in southeastern West Virginia... Southwestern Summers County in southeastern West Virginia... * Until midnight EDT Thursday. * At 401 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen since this morning. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible this evening in the warned area. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bluefield... Princeton... Athens... Matoaka... Camp Creek... Pipestem... This includes the following streams and drainages... Beech Fork, Beaver Branch, Big Branch, Blacklick Creek, Bluestone River, Big Spring Branch and Big Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
